title: Im not mad that Battlecast Illaoi won....
body:
but for the love of god Riot. If you actually care about her do NOT keep the hand on the end of the tentacle. It just looks god awful. Just use the kinda tentacle you have on BC Vel'koz or something of the like. Not a damn robotic arm.

EDIT: allow me to clarify, I voted for Deep Space but Battlecast was my second choice, Just the hand did it in for me. I couldnt bring myself to vote for it because of it. If they make the hand look super badass or give it some unique animation, then maybe. But until we know for sure i just want a regular robotic tentacle.

replies.body:
Quick reminder: It's not even necessarily a battlecast skin. They even mentioned that the names are pointer into the direction of the skin.
If they turned  it into a Dreadnova skin, now that would be cool.
I'm really surprised that skin won. When the poll started almost everyone was arguing over whether deep space or adventurer was the best skin. (It was deep space)

That was just a rough concept they showed us there, so I really hope it doesn't look that awful when they show us the progress on the skin. Or it really will be a total shame that the theme won over others that were more deserving.
How were the others more deserving if they didn't win? Wasn't the whole put of the vote to pick the best skin?

We don't honestly really have any evidence people actually voted for it and it wasn't rigged. People from both reddit and this forum seem to have favored Adventurer and deep space over the battle-cast which was widely known to be the least popular.

Geez, conspiracy theories everywhere.

Riot's goal is to sell as many skins as possible. Tell me, what would be the motivation to rig such an event then?
In the end, this would end in them creating a skin the community doesn't want in majority, which means less sold skins.

There is absolutely no motive here. Why do people always assume that an event is rigged just because their favourite didn't win?

It's not about my favorite didn't win, the visual support of that choices is missing. Plus you make a lot more money by reducing costs and promoting efficiency and battle cast has far too many assets. It's not hard to think battle cast would be the cheapest one to invest time and concept on to create. I get the "Trying to sell the most skins" idea but that's for things like Jinx and draven getting a christmas skin even though 2 adc's just got a skin. And why? because ADC's are the bread and butter meta right now they're even buffing shields and heals again. This is what they count on selling, Illaoi is a guinea pig to "please" the community skin but it's probably on a budget. But yea it's all a theory, but forgive me for having lack of trust in them lately and seeing how the genetic choice that is always choose to make is the one they're making again. Why do you think they clone themes so much? is a hell of a lot cheaper than proceeding with something new.

The boards and Reddit are a very small, yet very vocal minority. When you take into consideration that the link to the poll was posted on the client, so everyone could see that the poll existed whether they use Reddit/The Boards or not, leading to the vote being based off of the entire player-base instead of just the forum users.

If that would be the case, they would have simply given us 3 existing skin themes from the start, like letting us chose between Battlecast, Poolparty and DnD for example.

Would preserve that "cheaper to do existing stuff", while eliminating the need to rig a vote and therefore taking yourself away the opportunity to see what the community would pay the most money for.

They didn't have to present us new concepts like Adventurer in the first place. So I still see no point in rigging this event. And I think it's extremely sad that some people accuse Riot to do stuff like that when this whole event was actually a great thing they did for the community...

You dont seem to understand how tiny of a fraction the boards and reddit contain of the entire playerbase.  Thats why no one here should ever say "the community agrees" or "the community hates"  because frankly this place is a very tiny and very biased part of the actual community.
This wasn't the best, the others were far better themes.

Your personal opinion, nothing else, sorry.
Battlecast was the best skin for me, hence why I voted for it. =/
